articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said that sirens sounded in several areas of central Israel after the projectile launch.
articles.title: Rockets from Lebanon wound 11 in Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli military official said a senior Hezbollah operative was captured.
articles.title: Israeli naval force detains person after landing in Lebanese coastal town, sources say

articles.author: James Oliphant, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump head to North Carolina on Saturday to try to clinch support in the southeastern battleground state just three days before Tuesday's U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Trump, Harris head to North Carolina in US election campaign's final weekend

articles.author: Susana Vera
articles.description: An arts and science centre which normally plays host to opera performances was on Saturday transformed into the nerve centre for the clean-up operation after catastrophic floods in eastern Spain which have claimed at least 207 lives.
articles.title: Thousands join effort to clean up catastrophic Spanish floods

articles.author: Josh Smith
articles.description: The South Korean president's administration blames North Korea for raising tensions with weapons tests and providing military aid and troops for Russia’s war in Ukraine.
articles.title: North Korea white paper says Yoon Suk Yeol raised risk of nuclear war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least two people were wounded in an overnight Russian drone strike on the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, city officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Two injured in Russian drone attack on Kyiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The third phase of a delayed polio vaccination campaign in Gaza will begin on Saturday, aid organisations said on Friday, after the rollout was derailed by Israeli bombardments, mass displacement and lack of access.
articles.title: Delayed Gaza polio vaccinations to resume on Saturday, agencies say

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Pro-Western incumbent Maia Sandu faces former prosecutor general Alexandr Stoianoglo, who is backed by the traditionally pro-Russian Socialist Party.
articles.title: Moldova says Russia plans to disrupt expatriate voting in Sunday's runoff

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Adam Makary, Ahmed Tolba
articles.description: Senior officials of the rival Palestinian groups Fatah and Hamas are meeting in Cairo to discuss forming a committee to manage Gaza's post-war governance, an Egyptian security source was quoted as saying by Egypt's Al Qahera News TV on Saturday.
articles.title: Egypt hosts Fatah-Hamas post-war Gaza talks as part of ceasefire efforts

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: A self-proclaimed straight speaker, Kemi Badenoch will bring a combative right-wing tone to the role of leader of Britain's Conservative Party, vowing a return to "authentic conservatism" to rebuild a party facing an uphill struggle to return to power.
articles.title: Who is Kemi Badenoch, the UK Conservatives' new leader?
